headline.print_headline: Traffic Clogs Up on a Shrunken Mississippi
headline.seo: Drought Clogs Traffic on Shrunken Mississippi River
headline.main: Drought Clogs Traffic on a Shrunken Mississippi

docs.snippet: A stretch of the lower Mississippi River has been closed periodically since Aug. 12 because falling water levels have endangered shipping traffic....
docs.abstract: Stretch of the lower Mississippi River has been closed periodically since mid August because falling water levels have endangered shipping traffic; river, shrunk by the summer's drought, has fallen to levels near the records set in 1988.
docs.lead_paragraph: A stretch of the lower Mississippi River has been closed periodically since Aug. 12 because falling water levels have endangered shipping traffic.

headline.seo: The Dangers of Diluted Bitumen Oil

docs.snippet: The nation’s pipeline network is governed by laws and regulations that were written long before the unique risks and hazards associated with dilbit began to emerge....
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by David Sassoon, publisher of InsideClimate News, warns of the environmental dangers of diluted bitumen, or dilbit, a thick 'garbage' crude oil produced from oil sands that is diluted by harsh liquid chemicals to get it through pipelines; holds nation’s pipeline network is governed by laws and regulations that were written long before the unique risks and hazards associated with dilbit began to emerge.
docs.lead_paragraph: The nation’s pipeline network is governed by laws and regulations that were written long before the unique risks and hazards associated with dilbit began to emerge.

headline.seo: WikiLeaks and the Global Future of Free Speech

docs.snippet: If Julian Assange is extradited to the United States, it would have consequences around the world....
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by filmmakers Michael Moore and Oliver Stone applauds Ecuador's decision to grant diplomatic asylum to WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange; suggests British and Swedish governments' main goal is to get Assange to Sweden, where he could probably be more easily extradited to the United States; warns extradition would have grave consequences for freedom of speech around the world.

byline.original: By MICHAEL MOORE and OLIVER STONE

docs.lead_paragraph: If Julian Assange is extradited to the United States, it would have consequences around the world.

headline.print_headline: House Member Is Rebuked After Nude Swim in Israel
headline.seo: After Skinny-Dipping in Israel, Rep. Kevin Yoder Is Rebuked
headline.main: House Member Is Rebuked After Nude Swim in Israel

docs.snippet: Representative Kevin Yoder of Kansas was scolded by House leaders after skinny-dipping in the Sea of Galilee during a late-night swim last summer with other Republican congressmen....
docs.abstract: Representative Kevin Yoder of Kansas is scolded by House leaders after skinny-dipping in the Sea of Galilee during a late-night swim in summer 2011 with other Republican congressmen.
docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Kevin Yoder of Kansas was scolded by House leaders after skinny-dipping in the Sea of Galilee during a late-night swim last summer with other Republican congressmen.

headline.print_headline: Host to Masters Drop Barrier By Adding Female Members
headline.seo: Condoleezza Rice Joins Augusta National Golf Club
headline.main: Avid Golfer Rice Jumps a Barrier Again

docs.snippet: Condoleezza Rice has golfed more often since she served as Secretary of State. Now, she is one of the first two female members admitted to Augusta National Golf Club....
docs.abstract: Former Secretary of State Condoleeza Rice becomes one of the first two female members admitted to the Augusta National Golf Club, the home of the Masters tournament, which has excluded women as members throughout its 80-year history; South Carolina financier and philanthropist Darla Moore is the other new member.
docs.lead_paragraph: Condoleezza Rice has golfed more often since she served as Secretary of State. Now, she is one of the first two female members admitted to Augusta National Golf Club.

headline.seo: New Frontiers of Extremism From the G.O.P.

docs.snippet: The comment about rape made by Representative Todd Akin of Missouri shows that he and fellow primary winners are moving ever rightward with the Republican Party....
docs.abstract: Editorial contends that Republicans want Rep Todd Akin to drop out of the United States Senate race in Missouri not because they find his comment about rape inexcusable, but because they are afraid he will lose; warns that anyone who replaces Akin will hold similarly extreme views about abortion and other issues, given party's embrace of the far right.
docs.lead_paragraph: The comment about rape made by Representative Todd Akin of Missouri shows that he and fellow primary winners are moving ever rightward with the Republican Party.
